text: the most interesting part is Super Bowl
xlviii came right at the start with the
announcement that the gametime
temperature was 49 degrees this was the
first cold where the Super Bowl after
all and yet all the intrigue and
apprehension that snow and ice and who
knows what else would make the game
either memorable or horrible never came
to pass
instead what more than 82,000 not
particularly frozen fans at MetLife
Stadium and more than 100 million
viewers around the United States got to
witness was the kind of blowout that
used to happen all the time in the Super
Bowl although not so much lately
Denver's Peyton Manning in search of a
second Super Bowl title to enhance his
legacy is one of the great quarterbacks
in NFL history instead stepped on a
banana peel on the very first play from
scrimmage moving forward to call one of
his famous audibles just as his scent to
hike the ball right over his shoulder
the ball ended up in the end zone for a
safety and a quirky two-nothing Seattle
lead and then it got worse - Seattle
field goals and then a touchdown and
then a 69 yard interception return of a
Manning pass that made it 22 nothing at
the half the third quarter began with a
89 yard kickoff returned by Percy Harvin
that piled on seven more points
Manning finally threw a touchdown pass
at the end of the third quarter but by
then the only thing keeping some of
America watching were the commercials
final score Seattle 43 Denver 8 Seattle
of City without a lot of championship
hardware now has its first Super Bowl
title Manning in Denver ended up with a
game to forget and the NFL probably
wishes that some of the snow forecast
for Monday had fallen on Sunday night
which would have made the game more
interesting than it turned out to be
this is Jay Schreiber for The New York
Times
